com.cubeia.firebase.api.util
Class TaskRepeater

java.lang.Object
  com.cubeia.firebase.api.util.TaskRepeater

public class TaskRepeater
extends Object

This simple utility executes a task one or more times. The task returns a boolean for each execution, if that boolean is "false" the repeat will continue, should the task return "true" the repeater ends and returns.

This object is thread safe and can be used concurrently.

Author:
Lars J. Nilsson

Constructor Detail

TaskRepeater

public TaskRepeater(String name,
                    int repeats,
                    long repeatDelay)
Parameters:
name - Name of the task, used for logging
repeats - Max number of repeats to do
repeatDelay - Delay in milliseconds between repeats
Method Detail

close

public void close()
Close this repeater, this will cause all invocations to "execute" to return immediately and subsequent calls to always return "false".

safeExecute

public boolean safeExecute(Callable<Boolean> task)
This method does the same as execute(Callable) with the exception that it catches and logs any errors. Should be used only when the task is known to be safe.

Parameters:
task - Task to execute, must not be null
Returns:
True if the task is executed, false otherwise

execute

public boolean execute(Callable<Boolean> task)
                throws Exception
Repeat the task until either the task returns "true", or until the configured timeout occurs. If the tasks has returned "true" this method also returns true, otherwise it returns false.

Parameters:
task - Task to execute, must not be null
Returns:
True if the task is executed, false otherwise
Throws:
Exception - If the task throws en exception
